entries.meaning: A state of discomfort arising from bashfulness or consciousness of having violated a social rule; humiliation.
A person or thing which is the cause of humiliation to another.
examples: Jack, you are an embarrassment to this family.
Losing this highly publicized case was an embarrassment to the firm.

entries.meaning: A large collection of good or valuable things, especially one that exceeds requirements.
examples: There are over 5,000 Americans now in Paris, many artists, singers, musicians, writers, and actors, so many, indeed, the committee could hardly pick a program from an embarrassment of volunteers.

entries.meaning: A state of confusion; hesitation; uncertainty
(medicine) Impairment of function due to disease: respiratory embarrassment.
